title: Historical Stock Splits and Corporate Actions of Colgate-Palmolive Co

content.text: In 1923, Colgate-Palmolive Co implemented a 2-for-1 stock split. This means that for every share of stock owned by investors, they received an additional share.
Another stock split occurred in 1927, with a 3-for-1 ratio. This increased the number of outstanding shares, providing greater liquidity to investors.
Colgate-Palmolive Co executed a 3-for-1 stock split in 1941, further dividing the existing shares to increase accessibility for investors.
A 2-for-1 stock split was implemented by Colgate-Palmolive Co in 1957. This action aimed to make the stock more attractive to a wider range of shareholders.
In 1964, Colgate-Palmolive Co announced a significant dividend increase, rewarding shareholders with higher returns on their investments.
A stock dividend issuance took place in 1968, allowing shareholders to receive additional shares of stock as a form of distribution instead of cash.
Colgate-Palmolive Co increased its dividend payout once again in 1973, demonstrating the company's commitment to delivering value to shareholders.
In 1994, Colgate-Palmolive Co carried out a 2-for-1 stock split, aiming to enhance marketability and accessibility of its shares.
